intro: Bourreria velutina var. venosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf burr, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often found in disturbed habitats. It has a sprawling growth habit and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its adaptability, it can become invasive in certain environments.
